Entries.default: You find stairs carved into the cliff. They're disconcertingly narrow in some places and broken in others, but they appear to lead all the way to the bottom.
You find stairs carved into the cliff. They're disconcertingly narrow in some places and broken in others, but they appear to lead all the way to the bottom.
Halfway down, you reach a spot where the stairs have crumbled away. Only a narrow ridge remains.
You consider the path before you.

Yet in the darkness, your keen senses detect another shape just below the gap.

It's a ledge, the remains of some old building. More importantly, it looks wider - and more stable - than the ridge of crumbled stairs.
The ledge proves sturdy and allows you to easily cross the gap.
You edge easily along the ridge and reach the steps on the other side.
You climb back to the top of the cliff.
You continue down the stairway until you reach the muddy ground below.
From here, the way down looks stable enough. However, you see a gap about halfway down the cliff.
You continue down the stairway until you reach the muddy ground below.
The ridge is surprisingly slick with mold. It's hard to maintain your balance, and the effort quickly becomes tiring.
